tools.name: pause_simulation
tools.description: Pause the physics simulation to explain a concept
tools.usageGuidelines: Use when you need to freeze the simulation to point out specific details or explain what's happening
examples: Pause to highlight the moment of maximum deflection
Pause to explain the forces acting on the pendulum

tools.name: resume_simulation
examples: Continue the simulation to see the next phase

tools.name: set_simulation_speed
tools.usageGuidelines: Slow down to observe fast phenomena, speed up for slow processes
examples: Slow to 0.25x to watch wave interference clearly
Speed to 5x to show full precession cycle quickly

tools.name: update_parameter
tools.description: Change an experiment parameter with optional animation
tools.usageGuidelines: Use to demonstrate how parameters affect the system. Animate changes for smooth visualization
examples: Gradually increase voltage to show effect on droplet
Animate bank angle change to demonstrate optimal speed

tools.name: create_note
tools.description: Display a text note on the simulation screen
tools.usageGuidelines: Use to highlight key facts or equations
examples: Show centripetal force equation at top-right
Display current charge measurement at bottom

tools.name: highlight_element
tools.usageGuidelines: Draw attention to important objects or events
examples: Highlight the particle when it reaches maximum deflection
Flash the slit when wave passes through

tools.name: get_simulation_state
tools.description: Get current simulation state and measurements
tools.usageGuidelines: Use to analyze current conditions before explaining
examples: Check current velocity before explaining forces
Read measurements to provide accurate feedback

tools.name: get_progress
tools.description: Get student progress on learning objectives
tools.usageGuidelines: Use to understand what the student has accomplished
examples: Check if student has explored enough parameter ranges

bestPractices: Always explain WHY you're using a tool
Use pause sparingly - only for critical moments
Animate parameter changes when demonstrating effects
Keep notes concise and positioned strategically
Use highlights to direct attention, not distract
Check state before making assumptions about simulation
Encourage exploration by adjusting parameters thoughtfully
